wikipedia_page.main: Anna Robena Laidlaw or Anna Robena Thomson (30 April 1819 – 29 May 1901) was a British pianist. She was court pianist to the queen of Hanover.

response: Robert Schumann's Fantasiestücke, Op. 12, is a set of eight pieces for piano, written in 1837. The title was inspired by the 1814–15 collection of novellas, essays, treatises, letters, and writings about music, Fantasiestücke in Callots Manier (which also included the complete Kreisleriana, another source of inspiration for Schumann) by one of his favourite authors, E. T. A. Hoffmann. Schumann dedicated the pieces to Fräulein Anna Robena Laidlaw, an accomplished and attractive 18-year-old Scottish pianist with whom Schumann had become good friends.J. C. Hadden, "Laidlaw , Anna Robena Keddy (1819–1901)", rev. Anne Pimlott Baker, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online ed., May 2008 accessed 28 Jan 2015
*Anna Robena Laidlaw (1819–1901), court pianist to the Queen of Hanover
